Description:
A Mid-Century Modern Masterpiece
This bespoke boomerang shaped home is a must see for all Mid-Century Modern enthusiasts.
A mixture of clerestory and floor to ceiling windows work in tandem to allow an abundance of natural light to flow through the fully renovated split-level home, which boasts a variety of unique features that meld seamlessly to excite your senses.
Many of the inclusions are original, such as the pressed copper front door and the eye-catching Tasmanian Oak panelling, whilst others have been sourced throughout the home’s restoration to complement the existing pieces and the original era.
The striking residence comprises an expansive living room, and this flows easily to a well-placed dining area. It is here you’ll truly appreciate the home’s elevated stature, and the far-reaching views that it allows; whether it’s the green vistas captured in the day time, or the twinkling lights of the night, you’re guaranteed to be spellbound.
Adjoining this is a brand-new kitchen which plays with a bold colour palette to create a space that is as aesthetically pleasing as it is functional. There is extensive storage space, stainless steel appliances which include a dishwasher and a SMEG 900mm freestanding oven/cooktop, plus a handy breakfast bench for casual meals on the run.
Completing the accommodation are three sizeable robed bedrooms and two sparkling bathrooms, including a master with a private ensuite.
The home also has endearing outdoor spaces. There are front and rear balconies that capture the surrounds, plus a substantial backyard which enjoys natural shade in the warmer months. It is the ideal place for relaxing, playing or entertaining, and there’s something for everyone with a choice of two paved patios, a children’s fort with a slide and five elevated vegie patch boxes for those keen to create an edible landscape.
The prime allotment of 866sqm approx. also allows extension of the current home, should further accommodation be required (STCA).
Further features include Tasmanian Oak floorboards, split system heating/air-conditioning, a double garage with an adjoining workshop space plus generous underhouse storage.
An amenity rich landscape further enhances the superb offering which enjoys a peaceful court location. You’re in close proximity to a wonderful array of reputable public and private schools including Luther College, Yarra Valley Grammar, The Rudolph Steiner School, Tintern Grammar, Good Shepherd Primary and Melba College. You can also walk to Croydon Train Station, buses and local shopping precincts such as Croydon Central which is about to undergo a major redevelopment to include a new Market Food Hall designed to offer customers a range of fresh food and dining experiences.
Whether you’re a staunch modernist devotee, or an astute buyer who appreciates distinctive flair, this home will command your attention. Inspect without delay to avoid disappointment.
